title: Chicken Noodle Soup
tagline: Classic comfort. 30 minutes with rotisserie chicken.
description: Classic comfort in 30 minutes using rotisserie chicken. Serves 6.
ingredients: 1 tsp fresh thyme (or Â½ tsp dried)
2 tbsp fresh dill or parsley, chopped
steps: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion, carrots, and celery. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and tomato paste. Cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in broth. Add thyme and bay leaf. Bring to a boil.
Add noodles. Cook according to package directions (usually 8-10 minutes) until tender.
Stir in shredded chicken. Heat through, about 2 minutes.
Remove bay leaf. Stir in fresh dill. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
notes: Broth matters: Use the best quality broth you can find. It's the backbone of the soup.
From scratch: For richer broth, simmer chicken wings with the vegetables for 1 hour before adding noodles.
Noodle tip: If making ahead, store noodles separately. They'll absorb liquid and get mushy.
Storage: Keeps 4 days refrigerated. Freeze broth and chicken without noodles.
source: Adapted from Once Upon a Chef
